Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="DeviceNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="Irp" inType="win:Pointer" outType="win:HexInt64"/> <data name="MajorFunction" inType="win:HexInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> <data name="MinorFunction" inType="win:HexInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> <data name="Parameter" inType="win:HexInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> </template>

<template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="DeviceNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="Irp" inType="win:Pointer" outType="win:HexInt64"/> <data name="Status" inType="win:HexInt32" outType="win:NTStatus"/> </template>

<template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="DeviceNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="Irp" inType="win:Pointer" outType="win:HexInt64"/> <data name="MinorFunction" inType="win:HexInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> <data name="Type" inType="win:HexInt32" outType="win:HexInt32"/> <data name="DeviceObject" inType="win:Pointer" outType="win:HexInt64"/> </template>

<template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="DeviceNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="Irp" inType="win:Pointer" outType="win:HexInt64"/> <data name="Status" inType="win:HexInt32" outType="win:NTStatus"/> </template>

Event.Message:
NVDIMM-N %1 failed to start. %6
This NVDIMM-N may be located using the following information:
Slot number: %2 Manufacturer: %3 Model Number: %4 Serial Number: %5 Location: %6
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="SlotNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="VendorId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SerialNumber" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Location" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Reason" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="Status" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:NTStatus"/> </template>

<template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="SlotNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="VendorId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SerialNumber" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Location" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message:
NVDIMM-N %1 encountered an error while transferring your data to or from persistent media (see the Details tab for more information). Some of your data may have been lost. As a precaution, this NVDIMM-N is now in read-only mode. If you want to keep using this NVDIMM-N, use the Reset-PhysicalDisk command to make it writeable again.
This NVDIMM-N may need to be replaced. It can be located using the following information:
Slot number: %2 Manufacturer: %3 Model Number: %4 Serial Number: %5 Location: %6
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="SlotNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="VendorId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SerialNumber" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Location" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SaveFailed" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="RestoreFailed" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="PlatformFlushFailed" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> </template>

Event.Message:
During a previous boot session, the NVDIMM-N %1 encountered an error while transferring your data to or from persistent media. Some of your data may have been lost then. As a precaution, Windows made this NVDIMM-N temporarily read-only. If you want to keep using this NVDIMM-N, use the Reset-PhysicalDisk command to make it writeable again.
This NVDIMM-N may need to be replaced. It can be located using the following information:
Slot number: %2 Manufacturer: %3 Model Number: %4 Serial Number: %5 Location: %6
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="SlotNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="VendorId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SerialNumber" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Location" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message:
NVDIMM-N %1 notified the driver that its health state changed.
This NVDIMM may be located using the following information:
Slot number: %2 Manufacturer: %3 Model Number: %4 Serial Number: %5 Location: %6
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="SlotNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="VendorId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SerialNumber" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Location" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="LostPersistence" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="WarningThresholdExceeded" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="PersistenceRestored" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="BelowWarningThreshold" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> </template>

Event.Message:
NVDIMM %1 encountered a serious problem and is now in read-only mode. Data that was saved to this NVDIMM-N may be lost when the computer shuts down or restarts. Consider backing up your data to another disk.
Use the Get-PhysicalDisk command to get more information about the associated logical deviceâ€™s health status.
This NVDIMM-N may need to be replaced. It can be located using the following information:
Slot number: %2 Manufacturer: %3 Model Number: %4 Serial Number: %5 Location: %6
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="SlotNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="VendorId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SerialNumber" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Location" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="LostPersistence" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="WarningThresholdExceeded" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="PersistenceRestored" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="BelowWarningThreshold" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_VoltageRegulatorFailed" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_VddLost" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_VppLost" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_VttLost" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_DramNotInSelfRefresh" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_ControllerHardwareError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_NvmControllerError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_NvmLifetimeError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_NotEnoughEnergyForSave" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_InvalidFirmwareError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_ConfigDataError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_NoEnergySourcePresent" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_EnergySourcePolicyNotSet" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_EnergySourceHardwareError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_EnergySourceHealthAssessmentError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="EncodedModuleTemperature" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="ErrorThreshold_NvmLifetimeError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ErrorThreshold_EnergySourceLifetimeError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ErrorThreshold_EnergySourceTemperatureError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="WarningThreshold_NvmLifetimeWarning" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="WarningThreshold_EnergySourceLifetimeWarning" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="WarningThreshold_EnergySourceTemperatureWarning" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="NvmLifetimePercentage" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="UncorrectableMemoryErrorCount" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="CorrectableMemoryErrorAboveThresholdEventCount" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

Event.Message:
The driver could not confirm that the NVDIMM-N %1 is healthy. To protect your data, the NVDIMM-N is now in read-only mode. Consider backing up your data to another disk.
This NVDIMM-N may need to be replaced. It can be located using the following information:
Slot number: %2 Manufacturer: %3 Model Number: %4 Serial Number: %5 Location: %6
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="SlotNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="VendorId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SerialNumber" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Location" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="NtStatus" inType="win:UInt32" outType="win:NTStatus"/> </template>

Event.Message:
The problem with NVDIMM-N %1 was resolved and it is now back in read-write mode.
This NVDIMM-N may be located using the following information:
Slot number: %2 Manufacturer: %3 Model Number: %4 Serial Number: %5 Location: %6
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="SlotNumber" inType="win:UInt32" name="ModuleHealth_EnergySourceHealthAssessmentError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="EncodedModuleTemperature" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data Event.Message:
NVDIMM-N %1 is in a degraded health state and may soon encounter serious problems. Consider backing up your data to another disk. Use the Get-PhysicalDisk command to see more information.
This NVDIMM-N may need to be replaced. It can be located using the following information:
Slot number: %2 Manufacturer: %3 Model Number: %4 Serial Number: %5 Location: %6
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="SlotNumber" inType="win:UInt32" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_VoltageRegulatorFailed" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_VddLost" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_VppLost" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_VttLost" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_ConfigDataError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_NoEnergySourcePresent" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_EnergySourcePolicyNotSet" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_EnergySourceHardwareError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="ModuleHealth_EnergySourceHealthAssessmentError" inType="win:Boolean" outType="xs:boolean"/> <data name="EncodedModuleTemperature" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="CorrectableMemoryErrorAboveThresholdEventCount" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

Event.Message:
NVDIMM-N %1 has encountered %6 uncorrectable memory error(s). Uncorrectable memory errors can cause system instability and data loss. Consider replacing this NVDIMM-N.
This NVDIMM-N can be located using the following information:
Slot number: %2 Manufacturer: %3 Model Number: %4 Serial Number: %5 Location: %6
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="SlotNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="VendorId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SerialNumber" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Location" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="MemoryEventCount" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

Event.Message:
The warning threshold for correctable memory errors on NVDIMM-N %1 has been exceeded. A large number of correctable memory errors increases the likelihood of an uncorrectable memory error in the future and reduces system performance. Contact your hardware vendor to determine if this NVDIMM-N needs to be replaced.
This NVDIMM-N can be located using the following information:
Slot number: %2 Manufacturer: %3 Model Number: %4 Serial Number: %5 Location: %6
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="SlotNumber" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> <data name="VendorId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="ProductId" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="SerialNumber" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="Location" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> <data name="MemoryEventCount" inType="win:UInt32" outType="xs:unsignedInt"/> </template>

Event.Message: Windows could not determine where one of the NVDIMM-N devices on the system is located. As a result, all messages about that NVDIMM-N in this channel will show an invalid number, %1, as the slot number. This is not a fatal error and there is no action required.

Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="DeviceGuid" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="Message" inType="win:AnsiString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>
